title: DataLoader autoconverts Float to Double
body_html:
Attempting to extract tensors from pandas dataframe:

>>> df.dtypes
A                           float64
B                        float64
C                             float64

Then building a DataLoader:

train_set = data_utils.TensorDataset(
    torch.from_numpy(df.as_matrix(['A', 'B'])).float(),
    torch.from_numpy(df['C'].values).float(),
)
train_set_loader = data_utils.DataLoader(train_set, batch_size=50, shuffle=True)

Despite the call of float method:

>>> next(iter(train_set_loader))
...
  1
 [torch.DoubleTensor of size 50]]

... I get double tensor

body:
Attempting to extract tensors from pandas dataframe:
```
>>> df.dtypes
A                           float64
B                        float64
C                             float64
```
Then building a DataLoader:
```
train_set = data_utils.TensorDataset(
    torch.from_numpy(df.as_matrix(['A', 'B'])).float(),
    torch.from_numpy(df['C'].values).float(),
)
train_set_loader = data_utils.DataLoader(train_set, batch_size=50, shuffle=True)
```
Despite the call of `float` method:
```
>>> next(iter(train_set_loader))
...
  1
 [torch.DoubleTensor of size 50]]
```
... I get double tensor
